content:
Hello Heike,

unfortunately in your screen shot you cut off the upper part of your Thunderbird main window which contains important information (menu bar, tool bars etc) for a helping person. What I can see is that your "Entwürfe" folder contains eight unread messages but TB doesn't display any of those messages in the thread pane My guess is that your problem is a classic exemple for a pitfall of the use (or activation) of the "Quick Filter" toolbar. It seems to me think that in your TB installation the Quick Filter toolbar is activated and you might have erroneously (?) clicked on one the buttons "Gekennzeichnet", Kontakt", Schlagwörter" or "Anhang" and probably also on the pin button "Beim Wechseln des Ordners die Filterkriterien aktiviert lassen" (on the far left of the toolbar).

Have a look at my screen shot in which I try to illustrate your problem: my folder "Entwürfe" contains one unread message but my thread pane displays none since I have activated the filter button "Schlagwörter" and the pin button on the left, which saves this view "Nur Nachrichten mit Schlagwörtern auflisten" whether you change the folder or restart TB.

You don't need to make a test by restarting TB in troubleshoot mode. Just disable the Quick Filter and messages in your Drafts folder should be displayed.
creator: Mapenzi

content: Indien de berichten via webmail nog wel beschikbaar zijn, dan zijn de berichten niet verdwenen. Thunderbird laat ze alleen niet meer zien, waarschijnlijk ten gevolge van de instellingen voor synchronisatie van IMAP. Zie https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/imap-synchronisatie#w_synchronisatie.
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: I would like some help here! Is this a bug or should I be able to get the paragraph style to revert to its default settings when I am replying to a message?
creator: hughtmccullough

content: Does that also happen in Troubleshoot mode (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/safe-mode-thunderbird)? If so, you could report it as a possible bug at https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/enter_bug.cgi/.
creator: siffemoz

content: It does happen in Troubleshoot mode. When I reply to a message, it seems that the formatting defaults to whatever the sender used and I have no way of changing it.
creator: hughtmccullough

content:
Odd. Try this:

- go to TB menu > Settings > General > Language & Appearance > Fonts > Advanced button

- at the top, set 'Fonts for:' to Latin if it isn't already

- change Proportional and Monospace fonts/sizes

- set Minimum font size to None

- at the top, change set 'Fonts for:' to Other Writing Systems

- repeat the process of changing fonts/sizes

- at the bottom, make sure 'Allow messages to use other fonts' is disabled if desired > OK > close the popup

- set TB menu > Settings > Composition > HTML Style to Variable Width and Medium font
creator: siffemoz

creator: siffemoz

content:
I'm using Linux (Debian Bookworm) and Thunderbird 128.11.0esr. I don't use a signature.

I may have found a clue to what is going on but I don't know the significance of it. When playing round with some of the offending emails, I tried to select forward instead of reply. This gives me a box with Subject, From, Date and To, followed by one or two lines of space and then the original email. If I delete all of the space between the box and the text of the original email then I can type in the space above the box and the paragraph style behaves properly.

If I select reply, then to get the paragraph style to behave properly, I have to remove all of the quoted text from the original email, leaving me with an empty page.

Although I don't use a signature, it seems that the offending emails might all have a signature or some other pieces with special formatting.

If someone is interested, I could now create a dummy email with no real content that has the problem and send it if I am given an email address to send it to, say by private message.

content: At this point, I would suggest reporting it as a possible bug.

content:
The doubled messages for incoming email for nsrusa.org were caused by my incorrect setting of the nsrusa.org default address (catch-all). An AI bot helped me find this problem.

However, the rDNS failure is still happening with some addresses. My opinion is that this is caused by a bug in the DNS propagation system, which relies on EVERY mailserver to honor TTL values, instead of pushing changes to all subscribed mailservers automatically.

content:
Hola, POP3 no es lo mejor para migrar de clientes de correo distintos.. Tendrías que buscar en la ayuda de Outlook que tipo de formato acepta para la importación de correos y contactos, desconozco porque no utilizo Outlook ademas este es un foro sobre Thunderbird. Luego revisar si algunos de los formatos soportados por Outlook pueden ser exportados con la herramientas de Thundebird ImportExportTools NG: https://addons.thunderbird.net/es/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/?src=search Por ejemplo esta Tools puede exportar los correos a: EML, HTML, PDF, CSV o plaintext

Saludos

If you're certain there is no mail to be kept in the old account it can be deleted.

Press Alt or F10 in case the menu bar is hidden. From the main menu bar: Tools - Account Settings Select the account to be deleted in the left pane. Click the big red 'Delete' button at the top right.

content:
Thunderbird has an automatic session restore function, so by default on quitting (closing) Thunderbird the actual session status will be saved in the "session.json" file in the profile, and on the next launching of TB you should see the same UI, with the same tabs, the same active tabs, the same expanded or collapsed folders, the same selected message ......etc as before. This is the standard (default) behaviour which certainly can be modified by certain add-ons .... and a corrupt session.json file

Open your Thunderbird profile folder, the close TB. In the profile folder search for the file session session.json and delete it. Restart TB, choose your account folders to be collapsed. Close and restart TB to verify if your choices have been memorised by TB
creator: Mapenzi
